Questions: Before doing garbage collection , _____ method is called .
finalize( ) is only called just prior to _________.
Java's garbage collector runs as a ______ priority thread waiting for _______ priority threads to relinquish the processor. Choose the correct sequence.
What is the priority of the Garbage collector thread of jdk?
Which of the following helps in garbage collection?
What is garbage collection in the context of Java?
Correct Answer: (c)     When all references to an object are gone, the memory used by the object is automatically reclaimed.
Wrong Answer 1: (a)     The operating system periodically deletes all the java files available on the system.
Wrong Answer 2: (b)     Any package imported in a program and not used is automatically deleted.
Wrong Answer 3: (c)     When all references to an object are gone, the memory used by the object is automatically reclaimed.
Wrong Answer 4: (d)     The JVM checks the output of any Java program and deletes anything that doesn't make sense.

Questions: The java run time system automatically calls this method while garbage collection.

What is garbage collection in the context of Java?
Correct Answer: (c)     When all references to an object are gone, the memory used by the object is automatically reclaimed.
Wrong Answer 1: (a)     The operating system periodically deletes all of the java files available on the system.
Wrong Answer 2: (b)     Any package imported in a program and not used is automatically deleted.
Wrong Answer 3: (c)     When all references to an object are gone, the memory used by the object is automatically reclaimed.
Wrong Answer 4: (d)     The JVM checks the output of any Java program and deletes anything that doesn't make sense.

Questions: Which of the following statements are true regarding the finalize( ) method?
Correct Answer: (d)     The finalize ( ) method can be overloaded
Wrong Answer 1: (a)     The finalize ( ) method must be declared with protected accessibility
Wrong Answer 2: (b)     The compiler will fail to compile the code that explicitly tries to call the finalize( ) method
Wrong Answer 3: (c)     The body of the finalize ( ) method can only access other objects that are eligible for garbage collection
Wrong Answer 4: (d)     The finalize ( ) method can be overloaded

Correct Answer: (d) If object obj1 can access object obj2 that is eligible for garbage collection, then obj1 is also eligible for garbage collection.
Wrong Answer 1: (a) Objects can be explicitly destroyed using the keyword delete
Wrong Answer 2: (b) An object will be garbage collected immediately after it becomes unreachable
Wrong Answer 3: (c) If object obj1 is accessible from object obj2, and object obj2 is accessible from obj1, then obj1 and obj2 are not eligible for garbage collection
Wrong Answer 4: (d) If object obj1 can access object obj2 that is eligible for garbage collection, then obj1 is also eligible for garbage collection.

Correct Answer: (b) All objects have a finalize() method
Wrong Answer 1: (a) If an exception is thrown during the execution of the finalize() method of an eligible object, then the exception is ignored and the object is destroyed
Wrong Answer 2: (b) All objects have a finalize() method
Wrong Answer 3: (c) Objects can be destroyed by explicitly calling the finalize() method
Wrong Answer 4: (d) The finalize() method can be declared with any accessibility
